description: Phase 2: Server deployment features - Ubuntu distros, NixOS, proxy/API hosting

userStories.title: Make Ubuntu 22.04 rootfs download and extract work
acceptanceCriteria: Ubuntu XFCE4/MATE/GNOME variants download from CDN
Rootfs extracts with proper symlinks preserved
PRoot can launch /bin/bash in Ubuntu rootfs
userStories.notes: Requires download service to work + larger rootfs handling

userStories.title: Add NixOS as a distribution option
acceptanceCriteria: NixOS variant appears in distro selection
Nix package manager works in proot environment

userStories.title: Implement SSH server in proot environment
acceptanceCriteria: dropbear or openssh-server runs inside proot
User can SSH into the container from another device
userStories.notes: SSH enables remote access to container

userStories.title: Add simple HTTP proxy server capability
acceptanceCriteria: tinyproxy or similar can be installed and run
Proxy is accessible from local network
UI shows proxy status and port
userStories.notes: Core use case: mobile proxy server

userStories.title: Add API server hosting support
acceptanceCriteria: Node.js/Python/Go can be installed in environment
Simple HTTP server can bind to port and serve requests

userStories.title: Add persistent storage for server data
Add network status and port display in UI
acceptanceCriteria: UI shows open ports and services
userStories.notes: User needs to know how to connect

userStories.title: Add one-click service templates
acceptanceCriteria: Template for: HTTP proxy, SSH server, Node.js API
One tap to deploy a service
